Arrows

Nifty arrows generated using CSS borders. Size and color are based on the parent currentColor and font-size by default. Custom arrows can be generated using the triangle mixin.

Up:

Right:

Down:

Left: 

<p>Up: <span class="arrow-up"></span></p>
<p>Right: <span class="arrow-right"></span></p>
<p>Down: <span class="arrow-down"></span></p>
<p>Left: <span class="arrow-left"></span></p>

Equilateral

Variation of arrows that are equilateral (rather than isosceles). These can appear more balanced in certain contexts.

<button class="btn btn-info btn-rounded">
  <span class="arrow-left-equilateral" aria-hidden="true"></span>
  Previous
</button>

<button class="btn btn-info btn-rounded">
  Next
  <span class="arrow-right-equilateral" aria-hidden="true"></span>
</button>

Before & After

You can also include arrows as an element's :before or :after pseudo-elements by appending -before or -after to the arrow class name, applied to the desired parent element.

<button class="btn btn-info btn-rounded arrow-left-equilateral-before">
  Previous
</button>

<button class="btn btn-info btn-rounded arrow-right-equilateral-after">
  Next
</button>

Toggle

Including the class arrow-toggle on any of these elements will allow the arrow to flip 180deg when the class active is applied.

<button class="btn btn-default arrow-down-after arrow-toggle">
  You spin me right round
</button>

<button class="btn btn-default arrow-down-after arrow-toggle active">
  Like a record, baby
</button>
